definition:
The linear differential equation $$\begin{aligned}
a_n(x)y^{(n)}+a_{n-1}(x)y^{(n-1)}+\ldots+a_1(x)y'+a_0(x)y \;=\; b(x)\end{aligned}$$
is called iff $b(x) \equiv 0$. If $b(x) \not\equiv 0$, the equation (1)
is [*inhomogeneous*]{}.\
If (1) is , then the sum of any solutions is a solution and any solution
multiplied by a constant is a solution.\
The special case
$$c_nx^ny^{(n)}+c_{n-1}x^{n-1}y^{(n-1)}+\ldots+c_1xy'+c_0y \;=\; 0$$ of
(1), where the $c_i$’s are constants, can via the substitution $x = e^t$
be transformed into a homogeneous linear differential equation of the
same order but with constant coefficients.\
